member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.Build
member.summary: Builds a dictionary of parameters and values that can be set on the object.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetPromotionAction(GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.PromotionAction)
member.summary: Adds an action associated with the promotions in a given hit.
member.param: The action associated with the hit.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetProductAction(GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction)
member.summary: Sets a product action for all the products included in this hit. The action and its associated properties affect how the products added through are processed.
member.param: The product action associated with the hit.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.AddPromotion(GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.Promotion)
member.summary: Adds promotion related information to the hit.
member.param: The promotion related to the hit.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.AddProduct(GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.Product)
member.summary: Adds product information to be sent with a given hit. The action provided affects how the products passed in through this method get processed.
member.param: The product you wish to add.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetNonInteraction
member.summary: Indicates that the hit did not involve a user interaction.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetNewSession
member.summary: Starts a new session for the hit.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetCustomMetric(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds a custom metric to the current hit builder. Calling this method with the same index will overwrite the previous metric with the new one. Refer for details on how to set the custom metrics up.
member.param: The index/slot in which the metric will be set.
The value of the metric for the given index.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetCustomDimension(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a custom dimension to the current hit builder. Calling this method with the same index will overwrite the previous dimension with the new one. Refer for details on how to set the custom dimensions up.
member.param: The index/slot in which the dimension will be set.
The value of the dimension for the given index.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.SetAll(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IMap`2{System.String^,System.String^})
member.summary: Adds a set of key, value pairs to the hit builder. These values will be added to the hit when it is built. This function should only be used for advanced cases where none of the explicit setters work. This function should usually be called after all the explicit setter have been called.
member.param: A dictionary of all the values to be added to the builder.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.Set(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value for the given parameter name. These values will be added to the hit when it is built. This function should only be used for advanced cases where none of the explicit setters do not work. This function should usually be called after all the explicit setter have been called.
member.param: The parameter name to set the value for.
The value associated with the parameter name.
member.returns: The builder object that you can use to chain calls.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a value by name from the current instance.
member.param: The parameter name to get the value for.
member.returns: The value associated with the supplied parameter name.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.CreateTiming(System.String,System.String,Windows.Foundation.IReference`1{Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a user timing hit to measure app timing and performance.
member.param: Specifies the user timing category.
Specifies the user timing variable.
Specifies the user timing value.
Specifies the user timing label.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.CreateSocialInteraction(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a social networking interaction hit.
member.param: Specifies the social network, for example Facebook or Google Plus.
Specifies the social interaction action. For example on Google Plus when a user clicks the +1 button, the social action is 'plus'.
Specifies the target of a social interaction. This value is typically a URL but can be any text.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.CreateException(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an exception hit to track errors.
member.param: Specifies the description of an exception.
Specifies whether the exception was fatal.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.CreateCustomEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates an event hit to track events.
member.param: Specifies the event category. Must not be empty.
Specifies the event action. Must not be empty.
Specifies the event label. Optional if null.
Specifies the event value. Values must be non-negative. Optional if zero.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.CreateScreenView(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a screen view hit.
member.param: Specifies the 'Screen Name' of the screenview hit. Note: this will not affect subsequent hits. To do this, set the ScreenName property on the Tracker instead.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder.CreateScreenView
member.summary: Creates a screen view hit.

member.name: T:GoogleAnalytics.HitBuilder
member.summary: Class to build hits. You can add any of the other fields to the builder using common set and get methods.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Send(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IMap`2{System.String^,System.String^})
member.summary: Merges the model values set on this Tracker with params and generates a hit to be sent.
member.param: Dictionary of hit data to values which are merged with the existing values which are already set (using Set(String, String)). Values in this dictionary will override the values set earlier. The values in this dictionary will not be reused for the subsequent hits. If you need to send a value in multiple hits, you can use the Set(String, String) method.
member.remarks: The hit may not be dispatched immediately.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Set(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the model value for the given key.
member.param: The key of the field that needs to be set. It starts with "&" followed by the parameter name. The complete list of fields can be found at .
A string value to be sent to Google servers. A null value denotes that the value should not be sent over wire.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the model value for the given key added through .
member.param: The key to retrieve the value for.
member.returns: The value associated with the key.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate at which s should be excluded for sampling purposes. Default is 100.
member.remarks: 100 means no items should be excluded, 50 means half should be excluded, and 0 means all items should be excluded.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ExperimentVariant
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter that specifies that this user has been exposed to a particular variation of an experiment. It should be sent in conjunction with the Experiment ID parameter.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ExperimentId
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter that specifies that this user has been exposed to an experiment with the given ID. It should be sent in conjunction with the Experiment Variant parameter.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.AppInstallerId
member.summary: Gets or sets the application installer identifier.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.AppVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the application version.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.AppId
member.summary: Gets or sets the application identifier.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.AppName
member.summary: Gets or sets the application name. This field is required for any hit that has app related data (i.e., app version, app ID, or app installer ID). For hits sent to web properties, this field is optional.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ScreenName
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'Screen Name' of the screenview hit. On web properties this will default to the unique URL of the page.
member.remarks: Required for screenview hit type. Note: This parameter is optional on web properties, and required on mobile properties for screenview hits.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the page / document.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Page
member.summary: Gets or sets the path portion of the page URL.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.HostName
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostname from which content was hosted.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the language.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ScreenColors
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen color depth.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the character set used to encode the page / document.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ViewportSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the viewable area of the browser / device.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ScreenResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen resolution.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.Referrer
member.summary: Specifies which referral source brought traffic to a website. This value is also used to compute the traffic source. The format of this value is a URL.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.LocationOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets the geographical location of the user. The geographical ID should be a two letter country code or a criteria ID representing a city or region (see http://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/protocol/v1/geoid). This parameter takes precedent over any location derived from IP address, including the IP Override parameter. An invalid code will result in geographical dimensions to be set to '(not set)'.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.UserAgentOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets the User Agent of the browser. Note that Google has libraries to identify real user agents. Hand crafting your own agent could break at any time.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.IpOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address of the user. This should be a valid IP address in IPv4 or IPv6 format. It will always be anonymized just as though anonymize IP had been used.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.ClientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that anonymously identifies a particular user, device, or browser instance. For the web, this is generally stored as a first-party cookie with a two-year expiration. For mobile apps, this is randomly generated for each particular instance of an application install. The value of this field should be a random UUID (version 4) as described in .

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.AnonymizeIP
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the IP address of the sender will be anonymized.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker.PropertyId
member.summary: Gets or sets the tracking ID / web property ID. The format is UA-XXXX-Y. All collected data is associated by this ID.

member.name: T:GoogleAnalytics.Tracker
member.summary: Represents an object capable of tracking events for a single Google Analytics property.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.Resume
member.summary: Resumes operations after is called.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.SuspendAsync
member.summary: Suspends operations and dispatches all pending hits in the queue.
member.remarks: Call when returning from a suspended state to resume operations.
member.returns: Operation returns when all s have been flushed.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.DispatchAsync
member.summary: Dispatches all hits in the queue.
member.returns: Returns once all items that were in the queue at the time the method was called have finished being sent.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.Clear
member.summary: Empties the queue of s waiting to be dispatched.
member.remarks: If a is actively beeing sent, this will not abort the request.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.FireEventsOnUIThread
member.summary: When set to true, , , and will fire back into UI thread.
member.remarks: You must set this property to true to listen to these events from a Javascript app.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.AutoAppLifetimeMonitoring
member.summary: Enables (when set to true) automatic dispatching of queued on app Suspend, and automatic restart of dispatch timer upon resume.
member.remarks: Default value is false, since we default to immediate dispatching. See

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the dispatcher is enabled. If disabled, hits will be queued but not dispatched.
member.remarks: Typically this is used to indicate whether or not the network is available.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.DispatchPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency at which hits should be sent to the service. Default is immediate.
member.remarks: Setting to TimeSpan.Zero will cause the hit to get sent immediately.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets or sets the user agent request header used by Google Analytics to determine the platform and device generating the hits.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.BustCache
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a cache buster should be applied to all requests. Default is false.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.PostData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data should be sent via POST or GET method. Default is POST.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.ThrottlingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether throttling should be used. Default is false.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.IsDebug
member.summary: Gets or sets whether s should be sent to the debug endpoint. Default is false.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.IsSecure
member.summary: Gets or sets whether s should be sent via SSL. Default is true.

member.name: E:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.HitMalformed
member.summary: Provides notification that a was malformed and rejected by Google Analytics.

member.name: E:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.HitSent
member.summary: Provides notification that a has been been successfully sent.

member.name: E:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.HitFailed
member.summary: Provides notification that a failed to send.
member.remarks: Failed s will be added to the queue in order to reattempt at the next dispatch time.

member.summary: Removes and cleans up a given .

member.summary: Gets the instance of used by the instantiated by this manager.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.AppOptOut
member.summary: True when the user has opted out of analytics, this disables all tracking activities.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.AutoTrackNetworkConnectivity
member.summary: Enables (when set to true) listening to network connectivity events to have trackers behave accordingly to their connectivity status.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.AnalyticsManager.ReportUncaughtExceptions

member.name: T:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.Product
member.summary: Class to construct product related information for a Google Analytics hit. Use this class to report information about products sold by merchants or impressions of products seen by users. Instances of this class can be associated with both s via addProduct(Product) and Product Impressions via addImpression(Product, String).

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.TransactionTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's total tax. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.TransactionShipping
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's shipping costs. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.TransactionRevenue
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's total revenue. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.TransactionId
member.summary: The unique id associated with the transaction. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.TransactionCouponCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the coupon code used in a transaction. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.TransactionAffiliation
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's affiliation value. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.ProductListSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the list source name associated with the products in the analytics hit. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.ProductActionList
member.summary: Gets or sets the list name associated with the products in the analytics hit. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.CheckoutStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the checkout processes's progress. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.CheckoutOptions
member.summary: Gets the label associated with the checkout. This value is used for and actions.

member.name: P:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.Action
member.summary: Gets the product action for all the products included in the hit.

member.name: M:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction.#ctor(GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the product action for all the products included in the hit. Valid values include "detail", "click", "add", "remove", "checkout", "checkout_option", "purchase" and "refund". All these values are also defined in this class for ease of use. You also also send additional values with the hit for some specific actions. See the action documentation for details.
member.param: The action type to send.

member.name: T:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ProductAction
member.summary: Class to construct transaction/checkout or other product interaction related information for a Google Analytics hit. Use this class to report information about products sold, viewed or refunded. This class is intended to be used with . Instances of this class can be associated with HitBuilder::SetProductAction"/>.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Remove
member.summary: Action to use when a product is removed from the cart.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Refund
member.summary: Action to use while reporting refunded transactions to GA.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Purchase
member.summary: Action that is used to report all the transaction data to GA.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Detail
member.summary: Action to use when the user views detailed descriptions of products.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Click
member.summary: Action to use when the user clicks on a set of products.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.CheckoutOption
member.summary: Action to be used for supplemental checkout data that needs to be provided after a checkout hit.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Checkout
member.summary: Action to use for hits with checkout data.

member.name: F:GoogleAnalytics.Ecommerce.ActionEnum.Add
member.summary: Action to use when a product is added to the cart.
